newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil shares lower on new corruption allegations.
newsitem.headline: Brazil shares lower on new corruption allegations.

text.p: Brazil shares were 1.62 percent lower in the first half hour of trade following a report that Communications Minister Sergio Motta was linked to a scandal in which congressional deputies were alledgely paid to vote for a bill allowing re-election of President Henrique Cardoso.
The Bovespa index of the 48 most traded stocks

fell 173 points to 10,475 points at 1030 local/1330 GMT. Market turnover was low at 109.2 million reais ($102.1 million). Folha de Sao Paulo daily printed transcripts of the purported tapes of deputies' conversations that the paper said indicated Motta provided some of the money to buy the votes.
Traders said investors are selling in an emotional reaction to the report and shares may rebound somewhat later in the day on some bargain-hunting.
They also said they are awaiting government officials to make comments on the Folha story.
Bellwether Telebras fell 1.7 percent to 132.90 reais. State oil firm Petrobras fell 0.65 percent at 230.50 reais.
CVRD was 0.83 percent lower at 24 reais.
